function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Lack of consensus on the effect of urban density on the spread of infectious diseases","Impact":"Difficulty in developing effective strategies to control epidemic risk","Mitigation":"Conducting further research to gain a better understanding of the relationship between urban density and disease spread","Technologies":"Data analysis and modeling for urban planning","People":"Researchers, urban planners, and public health officials","Owner":"Research institutions, government agencies"},{"Description":"Insignificance of population density on infection rate and negative effects on the spread of COVID-19","Impact":"Incorrect assumptions leading to ineffective interventions","Mitigation":"Conducting rigorous statistical analysis and considering multiple confounding factors","Technologies":"Statistical modeling and data analysis software","People":"Epidemiologists, statisticians, and public health experts","Owner":"Health organizations, research institutions"},{"Description":"Complex temporal role of urban density in the spread of the virus","Impact":"Misinterpretation of data and ineffective response strategies","Mitigation":"Longitudinal studies to track the changing impact of urban density over time","Technologies":"Longitudinal data analysis and visualization tools","People":"Epidemiologists, urban planners, and policy makers","Owner":"Research institutions, government agencies"}]}
